intro: Tithymalus tuberosus, commonly known as the tuberous tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its swollen underground stems, or tubers, which store nutrients and water. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, grassy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
